description.overall: This function converts a file path to a Python module path. It takes a file path and a project root as input, and returns the corresponding module path. description.overall: This function constructs a directed graph representing the file dependencies in a given repository. It takes a filename, an Abstract Syntax Tree (AST), and the repository root as inputs. The function uses a tree visitor to traverse the AST and identify import dependencies. It then adds nodes and edges to a NetworkX directed graph to represent the file dependencies.

parameters.name: filename
parameters.description: The name of the file for which to build the dependency graph.

parameters.name: tree
parameters.description: The Abstract Syntax Tree (AST) to traverse and identify import dependencies.

parameters.name: repo_root
parameters.description: The root directory of the repository.

returns.name: graph
returns.description: A directed graph representing the file dependencies in the repository.

description.overall: This function creates a safe version of a directed graph by renaming its nodes to unique labels, then writes the resulting graph to a file in the DOT format. description.overall: The `analyze_project` function analyzes a project by parsing its Python files, collecting symbols, and resolving function calls. It returns a `ProjectIndex` object and a list of resolved calls. The function iterates over all Python files in the project, parsing each file into an Abstract Syntax Tree (AST) and collecting symbols using a `SymbolCollector`. It then resolves function calls using a `CallResolver`.

parameters.description: A list of all files in the project

returns.name: project

description.overall: This function calculates the net time by subtracting sleep times from the total duration. It is used for rate limiting. If the model name does not start with 'gemini-', it returns the total duration. If there are no items, it returns 0. Otherwise, it calculates the number of batches, sleep count, and total sleep time, then subtracts this from the total duration to get the net time.

parameters.description: The start time of the calculation.

parameters.name: end_time
parameters.description: The end time of the calculation.

parameters.name: total_items
parameters.description: The total number of items.

parameters.name: batch_size
parameters.description: The batch size.

parameters.name: model_name
parameters.description: The name of the model.

returns.name: net_time
returns.description: The net time after subtracting sleep times from the total duration.

description.overall: This function retrieves the timestamp of the last message in a specified chat. It does this by accessing the 'exchanges' list within the chat's dictionary, which contains a list of exchange objects. The function then takes the last exchange object, extracts the 'datetime' field, and returns it. If the 'datetime' field is a string, it attempts to parse it into a datetime object using the 'fromisoformat' method. If parsing fails, it returns the minimum possible datetime value.

parameters.name: chat_name
parameters.description: The name of the chat for which to retrieve the last activity timestamp.

returns.name: datetime
returns.description: The timestamp of the last message in the specified chat.

It first calls the `delete_full_chat` function in the database to remove the chat, then cleans up the application's state by removing the chat from the `chats` dictionary and updating the active chat if necessary. If all chats are deleted, it creates a new empty chat and sets it as the active chat.

description.overall: This function takes markdown text as input and renders Mermaid diagrams within it. It splits the markdown text into parts, processing even-indexed parts as regular markdown and odd-indexed parts as Mermaid code. If the input text is empty, the function returns immediately. If the `should_stream` parameter is True, it streams the processed text; otherwise, it renders it as markdown.
